title: UK weather forecast: Mercury to drop to -3C for Halloween before washout weekend
text:

Temperatures will plummet to -3C tomorrow as Brits brace themselves for a freezing Halloween - ahead of a washout weekend.

The Met Office says the mercury will drop to -3C in parts of north Scotland early tomorrow morning, although temperatures should pick up by the time trick-or-treaters head out in the evening.

Forecasters are also predicting heavy downpours to soak almost the entire country this weekend, bringing an end to the brief spell of bright and sunny weather .

The Environment Agency has cut its number of flood warnings in force today to 47 - and its alerts, which are less serious, to 50.

However, fresh showers this weekend raise the possibility of renewed flooding across the country.

(Image: Alamy Live News.)

A Met Office spokesman told The Sun : "On Halloween , there will be a south west, north east split with northern and eastern parts seeing mostly dry and sunny spells.

"But south and western areas will be cloudy with patches of rain. By the evening as trick-or-treaters head out, that cloud will spread to more north eastern parts of Wales.

"But it will be foggy adding an eerie feel to the evening and night."

A netweather.tv spokesman said: "During Thursday, it will be cloudy and damp over more of Britain for a time then wet for Ireland during Thursday evening and night. It will become milder as the wind veer to a southerly flow.

"Friday will be blustery with a fresh south then south-west wind.

"Heavier rain looks set to move across Britain early on Friday as a low pressure settles to the north-west.

"This means there will be unsettled conditions Friday into the weekend with sharp showers, blustery winds and further bands of rain.

"And as another low pressure heads in from the SW later on Saturday for Sunday bringing even more rain and showers it looks like there will be further flooding issues. It also looks very windy."

It will be a chilly start for many this morning, with lows of -3C in parts of north Scotland.

Highs of 12C are expected but much of the country will see single digit temperatures today, although the mercury will climb over 10C in some places.

Tonight there will be cloud and rain in Wales, southern and south-west England but it will be chilly with clear spells elsewhere.

Through the night, rain will spread northwards into Northern Ireland, central and south-east England.

Tomorrow morning it will be cloudy with outbreaks of rain in England, Wales and Northern Ireland but Scotland will be mostly dry and cloudy with the odd bright spell in the north.

Rain will spread into southern Scotland after noon but it will remain dry in the north.

On Friday it will be mostly grey and overcast with outbreaks of light rain and drizzle, although some showers in southern England are likely to be heavy.

Saturday will be cloudy as a band of heavy rain spreads eastwards across the country.

Met Office five-day weather forecast

Today:

Rain will continue at times across parts of southwest England, perhaps heavy in the far southwest. Otherwise, apart from the odd shower near to east-facing coasts, most areas fine with some sunshine after any fog clears.

Tonight:

Many areas fine with clear spells, allowing some frost in northern areas, and a few fog patches mainly in northern Scotland. Southwest Britain still largely cloudy, rain tending to ease.

Thursday:

Patchy rain in southwest Britain spreading north to Northern Ireland and perhaps some western fringes of Wales and Scotland. Hill fog in southwest. Further east, mainly dry with some sunshine.

Outlook for Friday to Sunday:

Many areas starting fine with patchy night frost. Rain and misty conditions in southwest England will become more widespread by Friday, before heavy rain and gales sweep in for Saturday.
description: Heavy rain is expected to return this weekend, bringing an end to the brief bright spell and raising the prospect of further flooding
